## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [addClass(element, className)](./blockly.utils.dom.addclass.md) | Add a CSS class to a element. Similar to Closure's goog.dom.classes.add, except it handles SVG elements. |
|  [containsNode(parent, descendant)](./blockly.utils.dom.containsnode.md) | Whether a node contains another node. |
|  [createSvgElement(name, attrs, opt\_parent)](./blockly.utils.dom.createsvgelement.md) | Helper method for creating SVG elements. |
|  [getFastTextWidth(textElement, fontSize, fontWeight, fontFamily)](./blockly.utils.dom.getfasttextwidth.md) | Gets the width of a text element using a faster method than <code>getTextWidth</code>. This method requires that we know the text element's font family and size in advance. Similar to <code>getTextWidth</code>, we cache the width we compute. |
|  [getFastTextWidthWithSizeString(textElement, fontSize, fontWeight, fontFamily)](./blockly.utils.dom.getfasttextwidthwithsizestring.md) | Gets the width of a text element using a faster method than <code>getTextWidth</code>. This method requires that we know the text element's font family and size in advance. Similar to <code>getTextWidth</code>, we cache the width we compute. This method is similar to \`\`<!-- -->getFastTextWidth<!-- -->\`\` but expects the font size parameter to be a string. |
|  [getTextWidth(textElement)](./blockly.utils.dom.gettextwidth.md) | Gets the width of a text element, caching it in the process. |
|  [hasClass(element, className)](./blockly.utils.dom.hasclass.md) | Checks if an element has the specified CSS class. Similar to Closure's goog.dom.classes.has, except it handles SVG elements. |
|  [insertAfter(newNode, refNode)](./blockly.utils.dom.insertafter.md) | Insert a node after a reference node. Contrast with node.insertBefore function. |
|  [measureFontMetrics(text, fontSize, fontWeight, fontFamily)](./blockly.utils.dom.measurefontmetrics.md) | Measure a font's metrics. The height and baseline values. |
|  [removeClass(element, className)](./blockly.utils.dom.removeclass.md) | Remove a CSS class from a element. Similar to Closure's goog.dom.classes.remove, except it handles SVG elements. |
|  [removeClasses(element, classNames)](./blockly.utils.dom.removeclasses.md) | Removes multiple calsses from an element. |
|  [removeNode(node)](./blockly.utils.dom.removenode.md) | Removes a node from its parent. No-op if not attached to a parent. |
|  [setCssTransform(element, transform)](./blockly.utils.dom.setcsstransform.md) | Sets the CSS transform property on an element. This function sets the non-vendor-prefixed and vendor-prefixed versions for backwards compatibility with older browsers. See https://caniuse.com/\#feat=transforms2d |
|  [startTextWidthCache()](./blockly.utils.dom.starttextwidthcache.md) | Start caching text widths. Every call to this function MUST also call stopTextWidthCache. Caches must not survive between execution threads.  Blockly.utils.dom.startTextWidthCache |
|  [stopTextWidthCache()](./blockly.utils.dom.stoptextwidthcache.md) | Stop caching field widths. Unless caching was already on when the corresponding call to startTextWidthCache was made.  Blockly.utils.dom.stopTextWidthCache |
